metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0753 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Active Model in Ruby on Rails 4.1.x before 4.1.14.1, 4.2.x before 4.2.5.1, and 5.x before 5.0.0.beta1.1 supports the use of instance-level writers for class accessors, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended validation steps via crafted parameters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-actionmailer - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-actionpack - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-actionview - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activejob - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activemodel - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activerecord - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-activesupport - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-rails - 2:4.2.5.1-1
ruby-railties - 2:4.2.5.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> In Oneiric-Saucy, rails package is just for transition; The rails package contains actual code from vivid onward

criterions.comment: rails package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.2.5.1-1').
